Reviews.Title: “Our Great Experience At Econo Lodge, Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: Buford S
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our trip to Branson, MO. Staying at the Econo Lodge was one of our best experiences in our travels. The front desk clerks, Rick, Jeremy and Lauri were very friendly and made our stay very pleasant. They were all helpful with our stay from check in to check out. Our trip was 4 days and during our stay, we had a very nice man named Jerry that attended our room. He made sure everything was clean and we had everything we needed to make our stay more enjoyable. I would recommend the Econo Lodge to anyone! Thanks to a GREAT staff at Econo Lodge. We will be back and will definitely being staying there again! Buford Shipley

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: terry f
Reviews.Content: we have been staying at this hotel for 3 years we visit branson about 15 times a year and we refuse to stay anywhere else! the woman at the front desk laurie greets us every morning with a smile like home and always helpful in whatever we need!rick the manager is awesome as well the rooms are always clean and well stocked its like a home away from home!thanks econo lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: ProgressiveHobo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a couple of the motels on Wildwood Drive this month that had rates less than 60 dollars. This Econo Lodge had the 3rd best rate compared to its neighbors on a Saturday night, but it was worth the few extra dollars. I stayed in a single king and the room was freshly remodeled with microwave and personal size refrigerator. It was a little smaller than a comparable room I stayed in at one of the competitors but had a nicer décor and new mattress. The Econo Lodge had a larger variety of TV channels compared to some of the others on the block that will make the price difference worth it when I return with my youngest. The room was very clean and the staff was very courteous. Breakfast had longer hours than most which was also a plus to me. This is a nice property in this price range and I am returning soon to check their double rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Room Clean, Courteous Clerks, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JB B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Branson for over 20 years at different hotels, depending on how long or how many were with me and how much I wanted to spend on a room. I had become unhappy with the hotel I usually stayed at for the last two years as it had become less clean, clerks less friendly and concerned. What a wonderful surprise Econo Lodge was. Large clean, nicely decorated room, refrig and microwave, quiet, good bed, good breakfast choices and the clerks I talked too seem really interested that I have a good stay there. The price was unbelieveably reasonable for this kind of room. A new renovation, inside and out, had just been finished the week before. I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris2828
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at this hotel and it was nice and clean. They are remodeling the rooms and it looks like they had just painted the outside. Beds where not to hard or soft and where not wore out and did not look like they where 100 yrs old. The carpet was nice and clean and didnt make your feet/socks black when you walked across it. All rooms are 100 percent smoke free which we had ppl that smoked with us and we just went outside and smoked. We didnt make any reservation and just walked up and got 2 rooms which one was not cleaned yet but the lady at the front desk went and got the house keeper and she got right on it and clean the room for us.Towels where white and didnt look old and wore out. Pools is not to big but was nice and clean. Hot tub did not work but they have put new chairs by the pool they still had the paper on them. Love that it is right behide walmart and it didnt take no time to get to the main strip. We had 4 kids with us that was running and playing and they never said anything to us abt it.Price was not to bad either it was 59 a night plus tax for two double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: They have recently changed owners & the cleanliness & courteous service left as well. We have stayed at this motel, in the same room, every year for 6 years, which we again requested 6 months before our arrival. When we arrived, we were told that this room was not available & given a smaller room, which we were told would be at a cheaper rate. At checkout time,however, an attempt was made to charge us the higher rate & only after my refusal, did I get the lower rate from a very unfriendly clerk. Also, the bottom of the stool looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a very long time & the bathroom floor was sticky. When we pointed this out to the clerk, again, she acted very disgusted with us,& said, "I'll tell someone", which never happened while we were there. Needless to say, we spent part of our trip this time, looking for another motel, & found a much cleaner & friendlier place to stay when we come back at Christmas. With so many motel choices in Branson, there is no need to have to tolerate rudeness & a lack of concern for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: New Management made all the difference with our stay! Hotel is in a great location to the strip and attractions. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Continental breakfast was just what we needed to help us with our vacation budget. Staff was right there when we needed them when we were looking for discount tickets to the shows! They helped us save a ton of money!! Kudos to the new management for making a big difference in the hotel and our stay compared to previous ones. We will definitely stay with them again in the future. With all of the choices for lodging in Branson it's nice to know that I made the right choice in sticking with the Econo Lodge! I highly recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Read Reviews but decided since it was under different managemanet ******”
Reviews.Author: rmr3599
Reviews.Content: Too long of a story to tell, but basically was given room other than the one reserved and then had hard time getting compensation back for lesser room quality. Experienced a 2 day run around with staff to get any satisfaction. Upon moment of checkout I was finally given some compensation back. Bed was hard which after 5 hours I would be up due to back problems. Rooms were clean, continental breakfast was decent. Chairs were older and we had to use a pillow in the seat to be able to sit in them. The room was just not comfortable due to the furnishings. The Motel is in a good location, the grounds were well kept and their booking system seems to have a major problem with giving you what you paid for. Just my honest opinion, hope others can have better experience in the future as the Branson area is a good place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Hostile Staff: A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: LaynaArkansas
Reviews.Content: One of the owners was at the front desk when I got there, and he was beyond rude-he was hostile. I would have left, but a nice lady that worked there made me think it might still be ok. The room was tiny, like a prison cell. It was clean but old, & the tub had something chipping off the bottom of it. The bed was the worst I've ever slept on. I would get my dog a better bed to sleep on than that. So uncomfortable-you could feel the metal coils. In vending everything was melted. The hot tub was drained & filthy. The pool was tiny, but clean. The free breakfast was canned mixed fruit, donuts from a box, frozen waffles. It was food-barely. Next day a new lady was there, and she was hostile as well. Apparently, they are having leadership issues, and the unprofessionalism was revolting. The only professional was a teenage girl that worked there, who checked us out when we left--4 days early. We had even paid for another night, but I couldn't take another minute there. It was an atrocity. This is a bad bed, bad food, a roof, a tv, and a hostile person taking your money. If that's all you need in a hotel, then this is the place for you. Good: Pretty clean, the internet worked, the pool was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggrandma001
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Branson in several years so assumed this motel was withing walking distance of shopping and restaurants - not! It was clean but nothing special. Beds weren't very comfortable but it did have a nice view and was very reasonable If you are looking for something right on the main street - this motel isn't it. I'm going back again this Oct. and will get something on the strip so we don't have to drive - traffic is crazy there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: bobkat45
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several places in Branson, and this one is not the fanciest but it is the best. Inexpensive, real clean, great location if you like quiet. Close to resturants and theaters, but very little traffic on the road by the property. We had a room facing a wooded area and it was very relaxing. No elevators so if steps are a problem, you may not want to stay here. Also outside entrances which we usually try to stay away from, but this place had doors that sealed well. I have seen some doors that have a big enough gap to allow critters to come in for a visit. We will certainly stay here again when in Branson. We paid nearly double the night before at a property on Sheppard of the Hill Expressway and it wasn't have the room.

Reviews.Title: “HARD BEDS”
Reviews.Author: GENEANDSHERRY
Reviews.Content: Motel is conveniently located in Branson and the room was very clean. However, the beds were very hard and the pillows were flimsy. I could hear someone in the room above me walking very late in the night he must have walked five miles in his room and I heard every step.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money.”
Reviews.Author: ilovetv31
Reviews.Content: it was okay for $40.00 but the remote for the tv did not work, it was 10 degrees out and no one had the heat turned on and then there was no happy medium with the heater it either burned you out of there or it was freezing. People were nice, room was clean. Bed was hard as a rock no extra blankets or pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lab4
Reviews.Content: Although it is an older hotel, it is well maintained and our room was very clean. It's not a 4 star hotel, but it doesn't advertise to be so. It's a great place to stay if you plan on being gone most of the time anyway. It was a good experience for us and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jessthestylist
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline which i will NEVER do again!- they rated it as a 2 star hotel but this is a one star MOTEL! because 1) it was so DIRTY my 4 year old daughter walked around bare foot for ten minutes after taking a bath and her feet were COLE BLACK 2) sheets were so piled, cheap and rough i had to ask to have my bed changed -the sheets needed thrown away- the staff was rude and just gave me some more sheets and wouldn't change my bed 3) there were no -as advertized waffles or bisquits and gravy the breakfast was so unappealing we went to mc donalds 4) front dest staff was rude would not give us rooms by each other.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain for the Budget minded”
Reviews.Author: fultongal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, not on the strip but accessible to attractions. It was quiet, no street noise. We had a king bed which was firm. We usually carry a 1 1/2" foam topper with us just in case and we did have to use it, that made a big difference. We were on the ground floor which is actually sub ground and it was dampish, there was a dehumidifier but it was noisy. The room was clean, new carpet, but the bathroom had mildew on the tile around the tub. Five minutes of new caulking would make a world of difference in the appearance. If you stay here, i would ask for a room on the 2 or 3 floor, that would probably eliminate the damp & mildew. The breakfast was adequate, cereal, toast, frozen waffles, donuts, coffee, juice. The front desk was friendly. If you are on a budget, I'd give this a try, we paid $46.00 a night, senior rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Hugsus
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was excellent. Along with the great bargain price it is only 3 blocks from the strip and away from all the traffic. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is your normal hotel breakfast. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. We will stay there again on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Econo Lodge”
Reviews.Author: dxschro
Reviews.Content: Nice Clean Hotel, good price off of priceline.com paid $ 40.75 for one night. Clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kloebug
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money! Our party consisted of 10 people, including 2 seniors, 4 young adults, and 4 children under the age of 4. Our seniors commented on how easy the hotel was to access and the children loved the pool. The hotel property was very clean and the rooms spacious. We requested 3 double queen non-smoking rooms. Upon arrival one of the rooms was only a single. The hotel staff immediately changed the room to a double. Great service! Everyone was very helpful and friendly. We all recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Night”
Reviews.Author: jsmltroyer
Reviews.Content: Nice location, the room was nice there was plenty of room for the family. The room had wireless internet which was a plus. the pool was clean the hot tub had some buildup though. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. over all a good value for the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 230 South Wildwood Drive, Branson, MO 65616
